benchmark_details.name: ZOFIE (Zero-shot Open-source Fine-grained Image Editing)
benchmark_details.overview: ZOFIE is the first diffusion-based image editing benchmark that incorporates both human subjective and automatic objective machine evaluations, assessing image quality, controllability of fine-grained edits, image-text consistency, background preservation, and semantic disentanglement.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark for fine-grained image editing that incorporates both human and automatic evaluations.

data.source: Publicly available benchmark dataset with human annotations and automatic metrics.
data.annotation: Human annotations and automatic metrics for editing evaluation.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the differences between images during editing and their effectiveness in achieving the editing goals.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better editing performance and more accurate semantic adjustments.
methodology.validation: Empirical validation through various editing tasks and extensive user studies.
